item.title: Jeff add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "All of old. Nothing else ever. Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Stanley Kubrick
item.description: "The most terrifying fact about the universe is not that it is hostile but that it is indifferent, but if we can come to terms with this indifference, then our existence as a species can have genuine meaning. However vast the darkness, we must supply our own light." -- Stanley Kubrick

item.title: Jeff add a quote by E.F. Schumacher
item.description: "Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius â€” and a lot of courage to move in the opposite direction." -- E.F. Schumacher

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jeff add a quote by John Maeda
item.description: "Simplicity is about subtracting the obvious and adding the meaningful." -- John Maeda

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Jeff add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell
